articles.content:
Resignation of S. Korean "Minister of National Defence" Demanded
   Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- At least 10 "national assemblymen" from the ruling and opposition parties of south Korea on May 15 demanded the "minister of National Defence" step down, asserting that he should own responsibility for threatening and attacking people by hurling military forces into Phyongthaek, south Korean MBC reported.

Talks between WPK and CPC Delegations Held
articles.content:
Talks between WPK and CPC Delegations Held
   Havana, May 18 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea and the delegation of the Communist Party of Cuba were held in Havana on May 17.
 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were members of the visiting delegation of the WPK headed by Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and Pak Tong Chun, DPRK ambassador to Cuba, and from the Cuban side members of the delegation of the CPC headed by Fernando Remirez, head of the International Department of the CPC Central Committee.    
 At the talks both sides informed each other of the activities of their parties and exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and two countries and a series of issues of mutual concern.
 The talks took place in a comradely and friendly atmosphere.

Greetings to Cameroonian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Cameroonian President
   Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Paul Biya, president of Cameroon, on Saturday on the occasion of the 34th national day of his country.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop favorably in mutual interests, the message wholeheartedly wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Nigerian Party Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Nigerian Party Delegation Arrives
   Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria led by Deputy National Chairman Ibrahim S. Shema arrived here Saturday.
 It was met at the airport by Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and the Nigerian charge d'affaires ad interim here.

articles.title: Nigerian Government Delegation Winds up DPRK Visit
articles.content:
Nigerian Government Delegation Winds Up DPRK Visit
   Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian government delegation led by Minister of State for Water Resources Bashr I. Awotorebo left for home after its 5-day visit to the DPRK on Saturday.
 It was seen off at the airport by an official concerned and the Nigerian charge d'affaires ad interim here.    
 During the stay the delegation visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Ugandan Military Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Ugandan Military Delegation Leaves
   Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Ugandan military delegation led by Aronda Nyakairima, commander of the People's Defense Forces, left for home on Saturday after its 5-day visit to the DPRK.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kim Jong Gak, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces.    
 During the stay the delegation visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung. And it also visited Mangyongdae, Kim Il Sung Military University and the Tower of the Juche Idea and others.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Head of Ugandan Military Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Head of Ugandan Military Delegation
   Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, was presented with a gift by Aronda Nyakairima, commander of the People's Defense Forces of Uganda who is leading the visiting Ugandan military delegation.
 The gift was handed over to an official concerned on Saturday.
